meanings.definition: To elaborate to excess or in great detail.
meanings.sent1: She tends to overelaborate her stories, making them longer than necessary.
meanings.sent2: Please do not overelaborate your explanation; just keep it simple and clear.
meanings.sent3: His tendency to overelaborate on minor details often leads to confusion among his listeners.
meanings.sent4: The artist didn't want to overelaborate the painting, so he kept it simple and elegant.
meanings.sent5: When you overelaborate your plans, you might lose sight of the main goal.

meanings.definition: Characterized by excessive elaboration or detail.
meanings.sent1: The overelaborate design of the dress made it difficult to move comfortably.
meanings.sent2: The report was criticized for being overelaborate and difficult to follow.
meanings.sent3: The overelaborate decorations at the party made it feel like a royal event.
meanings.sent4: Her overelaborate explanations only served to confuse the students further.
meanings.sent5: The overelaborate architecture of the building impressed visitors with its intricate details.
